description: Possibly a rhyming reduplication of halloo (“used as a greeting or to catch attention; used in hunting to urge on pursuers”), hilloa, hullo (“variants of hello”), and similar words.

entries.meaning: A clamour, a commotion; a fuss or uproar. [from 17th c.]
examples: Synonyms: ado, hype, to-do; see also Thesaurus:commotion
They made such a hullabaloo about the change that the authorities were forced to change it back.

verbs.description: hullabaloo (third-person singular simple present hullabaloos, present participle hullabalooing, simple past and past participle hullabalooed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make a commotion or uproar.
